title: Prework
text: This workshop will guide you through applied spatiotemporal modeling and robust index standardization using VAST and sdmTMB. You will learn essential R skills for fitting and diagnosing GLMMs, preparing data, and visualizing survey results—no prior advanced modeling experience required.

title: Prework
text:
Essential Software Setup
Before the course, please:

Install the latest version of R from cloud.r-project.org.
Install the VAST and sdmTMB R packages by entering the following in your R console:
install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("James-Thorson-NOAA/VAST")
install.packages("sdmTMB")
Verify that your system can run R from the command line (R --version in your terminal).
Optionally, install RStudio for a streamlined coding experience.

title: Prework
text:
Data Preparation
Please make sure you have:

Example abundance or CPUE datasets available (either your own data or sample data provided in the course materials).
Familiarize yourself with basic data cleaning steps, such as:

Removing duplicates and invalid entries
Ensuring complete columns for key variables (e.g., species, year, location)
Checking that all spatial coordinates (latitude, longitude) are expressed in consistent units and projections


If possible, bring your own messy dataset to practice hands-on cleaning and formatting.

title: Prework
text:
Course Communication
All participants are invited to join the dedicated workshop github website. Instructions for joining and sharing questions or resources will be sent prior to the event.

title: Prework
text:
Suggested Preparation Checklist

R and RStudio installed ✔️
VAST and sdmTMB packages successfully loaded ✔️
At least one fisheries or abundance dataset on hand ✔️
Ready to participate in coding and model-fitting—either on your laptop or using example data provided

No extensive pre-learning is needed. Just ensure your environment is ready, and bring your curiosity!

For troubleshooting software installation or dataset preparation, please contact the instructor ahead of time by email or via the Discord channel for support. ```

Adjust package installation commands for your local IT setup if needed.
Add or modify data-specific instructions (e.g., ABFT) based on your actual teaching materials.

title: Resources
text:
The following resources provide essential documentation, tutorials, and code for mastering spatiotemporal models and index standardization in R:




tinyVAST – Multivariate Spatio-Temporal Models using Structural Equations
Advanced R package for fitting multivariate spatio-temporal models with dynamic structural equations and Gaussian Markov random fields.
Includes installation instructions, theory, and worked examples.
sdmTMB – Spatial and Spatiotemporal SPDE-Based GLMMs with TMB
Modern and user-friendly package for flexible GLMM and spatial/spatiotemporal modeling in R.
Features detailed vignettes and hands-on guides for spatial fisheries applications.
VAST – Spatio-temporal analysis of univariate or multivariate data
Official GitHub repo for the VAST package, supporting robust spatio-temporal index standardization and advanced analysis for fisheries science.






glmmTMB
Generalized linear mixed models with zero-inflation and spatial structures.
INLA and inlabru
Bayesian inference for latent Gaussian models, applicable for advanced spatial/spatiotemporal modeling.
mgcv
Comprehensive modeling package (including spatially explicit GAMs and SPDEs).


For more code samples, see each package’s documentation, vignettes, or associated preprints.
